Our students matter.
Their happiness and their future.

Spark gives them control to determine their own learning – they choose the pace, the subjects, and the location, and we choose to create an educational system that can truly help them thrive.

We are like no other high-school.
About Spark

We are like no other high school. Our innovative learning approach gives a fresh and alternative accredited take on education for young people aged 13 years and over. We blend academic learning with wellbeing and future readiness to equip the next generation for the world. We offer the spark that will liberate your family.
We are a Cambridge-accredited hybrid high school with experienced teachers that offers a new type of education. Our educational model combines online and in-person learning and, most importantly, fits around you – your life, your family and your dreams.

Academics

The flipped learning model at Spark Hybrid Cambridge High School includes a mix of active and passive learning styles. Every student has the power to determine what learning path suits them best – choosing how, what, when and where they study.

The Hybrid Learning Model is based on 80% online learning - with the help of the Spark Online Learning Platform, online classes, tutoring sessions, assemblies, etc. - and 20% in-person learning - involving local schools, learning hubs, social challenges, volunteering opportunities and much more.
Students enrolled in Years 11, 12 and 13 are eligible to participate in the Cambridge International Examinations and earn Cambridge qualifications and certificates that are accepted for University enrolment in over 160 countries.

Wellbeing

We are a safe space for families to escape the traditional system. We are a transformative high school where families are encouraged to share contributions, mutual respect and work together to help teenagers be emotionally well.

Future readiness

We cultivate the potential within every student and help them achieve it. Young learners will be prepared to become lifelong learners and have a foundation toolkit with essential skills to welcome their bright future.

Admissions Process

We welcome students into a flexible educational environment whenever it suits them best, as admissions are open all year round and the process is focused on finding the best alternative for the teenagers’ future.

Family meeting

with our admission team to learn more about your story by filling in the form or directly booking a call

Academic initial assessments

that allow us to gain insights into the student’s abilities and knowledge and support their learning path with valuable recommendations:

  • English test
  • CEM Yellis for ages 14-16
  • CEM Alis for ages 16-19

Contract and wellbeing survey

that ensures they will nurture a holistic learning experience based on the P.A.I.R.S. framework (Purpose, Autonomy, Identity, Relationships, Self-re/design)

Start & Induction

to the hybrid high school that embraces your family’s needs

Tuition & fees

Spark flexible schooling offers an alternative learning path for those who dare to think differently. You have all the flexibility to choose from our offerings.

Academics

  • Choose any of the 55+ Cambridge Self-paced courses created around how teenagers' brains learn. See all the courses
  • Weekly commitment of around 6h / subject
  • Courses available at any time on our innovative platform
  • Peer-to-peer learning

Wellbeing

  • 23 Wellbeing sessions with Learning Journey Advisors (LJA)
  • Self-paced wellbeing course
  • Relationship policy (includes anti-bullying)
  • Safety & Safeguarding Policy

Future readiness

  • Purpose-driven career coaching
  • 1 self-paced course/ year

Spark Courses

Spark courses are ideal for students who: want an introduction to the curriculum and international standards for studying abroad, seek new concepts and perspectives in a specific subject, have a passion for a subject not available in the traditional schooling system like law or attend an international school without a specific subject available.

Academic courses

With support and guidance from a tutor and 1:1 sessions

  • Cambridge Courses available for IGCSE, AS or A2 levels
  • Access to our online learning platform
  • Flexible schedule
  • Self-paced with tutor
  • Flexible exams calendar: 2 sessions in May & October
  • Cambridge certificate accepted for university admission in 180 countries
  • IGCSE: 1450EUR/ course
  • AS/A2: 1850 EUR/ Course

Academic courses

Without support or guidance from a tutor, course only

  • Cambridge Courses available for IGCSE, AS or A2 levels
  • Access to our online learning platform
  • Self-paced
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Flexible exams calendar: 2 sessions in May & October
  • Cambridge certificate accepted for university admission in 180 countries

Starting from 450 EUR/ Course

Extracurricular courses

No support or guidance from a tutor, course only

  • Access to our online learning platform
  • Personal development courses
  • Gain skills in areas such as Leadership, Wellbeing, Global Education
  • Self-paced, available at your convenience

Starting from 150 EUR/ Course

Testimonials

Shine bright. Stand out. We force the world to rethink education for high schoolers because the traditional school system is outdated and often does more harm than good.

“Within two months, Tashi will have completed his first year at Spark and we can say that this school is what we ever dreamed of for him. Tashi flourished in many aspects and we, as parents, are very happy with his progress and with the space he has for cultivating his own interests. After the Spark experience, we cannot even contemplate the possibility of another type of educational environment for our child.”

Răzvan D (Tashi’s father)

"I’ve always been passionate about robotics and aerospace engineering for the past 5 years. I enjoy designing, building, and experimenting with my own STEAM projects. After all, the best way to learn is by doing, but I always struggled with managing both school and my projects, so this is where Spark came in. Spark is one of the few schools that actually prepares you for the real world and helps you find a goal in life. I want to be a NASA aerospace engineer, what do you want to become?”

Vlad M, year 11

“I am delighted with my daughter's process. She expressed her satisfaction with Spark, but I also see her enthusiasm every day in how she conducts her life: she makes clear choices, thinks for herself, knows how to accept or refuse without getting defensive or offensive, is aware of her value and expects others to recognize it. More than this, she's asking for help when needed, and most importantly, she treats people with kindness and expects to be treated the same way. In this phase of her development, Spark has undoubtedly been a decisive environment"

Dana D, (mother of Diana D, year 13)

“What I like most about Spark is the freedom to study at my own level, which is crucial for any kind of performance. The fact that I can choose what subjects to study helps me focus more on my most important passion, mathematics. Spark also offers me the possibility to learn things applicable to real life and focuses on developing every student as a whole.”

Alexandru D (also known as Tashi) - year 11
